metadata.title: CVE-2023-52439 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: uio:Fix use-after-free in uio_open core-1 core-2-------------------------------------------------------uio_unregister_device uio_open idev = idr_find()device_unregister(&idev->dev) put_device(&idev->dev) uio_device_releaseget_device(&idev->dev) kfree(idev) uio_free_minor(minor) uio_releaseput_device(&idev->dev) kfree(idev)------------------------------------------------------- In the core-1uio_unregister_device(), the device_unregister will kfree idev when theidev->dev kobject ref is 1. But after core-1 device_unregister, put_deviceand before doing kfree, the core-2 may get_device. Then: 1. After core-1kfree idev, the core-2 will do use-after-free for idev. 2. When core-2 douio_release and put_device, the idev will be double freed. To address thisissue, we can get idev atomic & inc idev reference with minor_lock.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
